title: Trio arrested as police discover burnt out car linked to attempted murder
text:
A man is fighting for life after being mowed down by a car in Harlow, Essex (Picture: Edward Starr)

Three men have been arrested after a man was mowed down in a hit-and-run in Harlow, Essex.

The 38-year-old victim remains in hospital in a critical condition after being found injured in Potter Street at about midnight on Friday October 18.

A blue BMW 1 Series was found alight in a field nearby, which police believe is linked to the collision.

Two men aged 24 and 34, both from Harlow, have been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder and failing to stop following a road traffic collision.

They remain in custody for questioning.

A 35-year-old man from Harlow was also arrested today on suspicion of conspiracy to murder.

The police continue to appeal for witnesses who were in the area at the time of the crash.

Witnesses have been asked to contact the Essex police Major Crime Team on 101, quoting incident 3 of Friday 18 October.
